a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Literacy rates, adult male, one-sentence test (DHS) vs. self-reports
DHS literacy rates are defined as the percentage of survey respondents, aged 15 and above, who can read a whole or part of
a sentence showed. UNESCO literacy rates correspond to the percentage of people, aged 15 and above, who say they can
read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
Literacy rate, adult male (% of males ages 15 and above) - UNESCO
Literacy rate, adult male (% of total respondents) - DHS
Data source: DHS Surveys; Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024); HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024)
